nodes.body: Closes #5171

### PR summary [8e5b5529fd](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/20824/commits/8e5b5529fddff2d64af04407c9953b196e6ff715)

#### Import changes for modified files

No significant changes to the import graph


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|

</details>

---

#### Declarations diff

No declarations were harmed in the making of this PR! üêô
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

---

<details><summary>Decrease in tech debt: (relative, absolute) = (162.00, 0.04)</summary>

|Current number|Change|Type|
|-:|:-:|:-|
|4406|-162|porting notes|

Current commit [8e5b5529fd](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/commit/8e5b5529fddff2d64af04407c9953b196e6ff715)
Reference commit [3bf4857ada](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/commit/3bf4857ada81ea603d1208f124c23c0c8543ece8)

You can run this locally as
```
./scripts/technical-debt-metrics.sh pr_summary
```
* The `relative` value is the weighted *sum* of the differences with weight given by the *inverse* of the current value of the statistic.
* The `absolute` value is the `relative` value divided by the total sum of the inverses of the current values (i.e. the weighted *average* of the differences).
</details>

The diff does what it says. Can you take a step back and tell us *why* this is fine to remove?

- Is there documentation what the linter did in mathlib3? Is that functionality incorporated into Lean core/ unnecessary somehow?
(If not, a better fix seems to be porting the linter to mathlib4. Is there are instructions what it does, I could try this myself.)
- If the linter is going to be re-porting, having those comments could be helpful, right? (At least, manually having to add this attribute 200 times will be annoying.) Or is your argument that one should re-audit all those locations anyway, so removing those notes now is fine?
(I've added the Zulip link to the PR description / eventual commit message.)
Thanks! Makes much more sense now.
bors d+

:v: kim-em can now approve this pull request. To approve and merge a pull request, simply reply with `bors r+`. More detailed instructions are available [here](https://bors.tech/documentation/getting-started/#reviewing-pull-requests).
bors merge
:-1: Rejected by label
bors merge

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/12879557624/job/35907224057)
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/12879557624/job/35907223856)

```suggestion
/-- A type synonym for a quiver with no arrows. -/
def Empty (V : Type u) : Type u := V

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - chore: remove porting notes about the nonempty instance linter
